events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and policy details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to assist the insured with processing the auto accident claim.
Formal acknowledgment of the car accident claim was sent to the policyholder with next steps outlined.
Request made for vehicle registration, photos of the damage, police report, and witness statements.
The insured submitted all requested documents including detailed photographs of the car’s damage and official police report.
Investigation commenced to verify the accident details and liability using submitted evidence and third-party sources.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of policyholder’s fault and full damage assessment performed.
A settlement offer was prepared based on repair estimates and coverage limits, and sent to the customer.
The insured responded with questions about the settlement offer and requested clarification on repair timelines.
Approval granted for the settlement amount and repair process was authorized to begin immediately.
Settlement payment issued directly to the repair shop as per the agreed terms and policy coverage.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation from the customer that repairs were satisfactorily completed.
All records and documents relating to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference as required.
